author: lightclient
content: did lighthouse devs weigh in on blob count since acd last week?

author: yperbasis
content: It's a bit unclear from the EIP how wrapped transactions are actually encoded. It says "the blob transaction is wrapped to become `rlp([tx_payload, blobs, commitments, proofs])`" . Does it mean: A) RLP string inside the list, i.e. `rlp([tx_payload_rlp_string, blobs, commitments, proofs])` or B) list inside the list, i.e. `rlp([[chain_id, nonce, ..., r, s], blobs, commitments, proofs])` or C) flattened list, i.e. `rlp([chain_id, nonce, ..., r, s, blobs, commitments, proofs])`  ?

author: lightclient
content: i think there is a PR to clarify more, but i didn't quite like how it was worded and meant to update

author: g11tech
content: i guess this is the PR in question ðŸ˜† https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/7123

author: lightclient
content: Btw what is the plan for pruning blobs and how have clients implemented archiving them? Right now it isn't in the era format, so we would need to extend era?

author: yperbasis
content: Tx hash is derived from transaction body, not from wrapped transaction, correct?

author: __flcl
content: Yes. And blob versioned hashes can be used to verify the wrapper, I guess
